data.title: Queens of the Stone Age
data.meta_description: Queens of the Stone Age (QOTSA) are an American rock band formed in 1996 in Palm Desert, California. Founded by vocalist and guitarist Josh Homme, the band is known for their unique blend of heavy rock, stoner rock, and alternative rock. They are recognized for their distinct sound...
data.text:
Queens of the Stone Age (QOTSA) are an American rock band formed in 1996 in Palm Desert, California. Founded by vocalist and guitarist Josh Homme, the band is known for their unique blend of heavy rock, stoner rock, and alternative rock. They are recognized for their distinct sound, characterized by repetitive guitar riffs, rhythmic drumming, and Homme's falsetto vocals.

Band History[]

After the dissolution of his previous band Kyuss, Josh Homme formed Queens of the Stone Age. The band has undergone numerous lineup changes throughout its history, with Homme being the only constant member. QOTSA gained mainstream attention with the release of their albums 'Rated R' and 'Songs for the Deaf', the latter featuring Dave Grohl of Foo Fighters and Nirvana fame on drums.

Band Members[]

Josh Homme: Vocals, Guitar

Troy Van Leeuwen: Guitar, Keyboard

Michael Shuman: Bass

Dean Fertita: Keyboard, Guitar

Jon Theodore: Drums

Discography[]

Studio Albums[]

Queens of the Stone Age (1998)

Rated R (2000)

Songs for the Deaf (2002)

Lullabies to Paralyze (2005)

Era Vulgaris (2007)

...Like Clockwork (2013)

Villains (2017)

Live Albums[]

Over the Years and Through the Woods (2005)

EPs[]

Stone Age Complications (2004)
